subject: A Lighter Shade of Pale
event: Thrice nominated, once victorious.  A double threat.  He wrote the script for his own wedding.  Has struggled against the Spider's sort, taken on Santa, caught a tiger by his tail.  Never reads the same book twice.  Last seen dancing home.

comments.article:
Brendan Gleeson? No idea on the role..

Please be Ciaran Hinds - For Roose Bolton!
Oh, I love it!
James Cromwell?
Not a White Shade of Pale?
Gabriel Byrne as Roose Bolton? I suck at these xD
OH DANG

John Lithgow as Craster!!!

A double threat in that film where he's the murderous twin and of course took on Santa in Santa Claus the Movie!!
comments.subject: I know...

comments.article: I don't think you understand the term 'double threat'. it's a term used in theater to describe someone that can act and sing. a triple threat can act, sing, and dance. that could still be the murderous twin guy, but that's just how the term is normally used. hmmmmm
comments.subject: Re: I know...

comments.article: David McCallum for...
Craster!
No, Roose
I'm guessing either Pyat Pree from the title, or... hopefully ROOSE BOLTON!!
Michael McElhatton as Roose Bolton
comments.subject: Roose Bolton

comments.article:
This is it! nice job
Michael McElhatton

-3 nominations for best actor and 1 win.
-was in the Santa Incident = “taken on Santa”.
-last worked on Shadow Dancer = “last seen dancing home”
-Was Fergus in Fergus’ Wedding which he wrote= “wrote the script for his own wedding”
-was in The Tiger’s Tail = “caught a tiger by the tail”
comments.subject: Re: Roose Bolton

comments.article: Sean Astin's character fought Shelob in LOTR. He was born in Santa Monica, and was in The Sky Is Falling, which I haven't seen but I found through search that there is a santa claus character. Maybe they fought? Not sure about the other clues yet.
comments.subject: Sean Astin

Unlikely. He's only appeared twice, and both times in Feast. Why would they yank him forward 2+ years?--what would that add to the narrative?

It should be noted that House Gatewatch over at Winter-is-Coming came up with Michael McElhatton literally minutes after WIC posted the casting clue. In the THIRD COMMENT. :)
kudos to  House Gatewatch :)
He has Bolton's cold, calculating eyes.
comments.subject: The eyes have it.

comments.article:
Congratulations, all. Or rather, some.

You've solved another one.

It's the distinguished Irish actor MICHAEL MCELHATTON. He will indeed be playing pale-eyed Roose Bolton, Lord of the Dreadfort.
